bibl.title: Letter from William F. King to John J. Moran, August 10, 1933

div1.p: King informs Moran that the date of the memorial session has been changed and urges Moran to attend.

div1.head: Letter from William F. King to John J. Moran, August 10, 1933
div1.opener:

President
JOHN A. FERRELL, M. D.
61 Broadway, New York
Acting Secretary

INDIANAPOLIS LOCAL

225 Wimmer Building

SIXTY-SECOND ANNUAL MEETING
OF THE
AMERICAN PUBLIC HEALTH ASSOCIATION
INDIANAPOLIS, INDIANA
October 9-12, 1933
AUGUST 10, 1933.
John J. Moran,
Care of Cia Sunoco de Cuba,
Ave Menocal No. 102-A,
Havana, CUBA.
My dear Mr. Moran:-
div1.p:
I wrote you sometime ago extending an
invitation to attend a Memorial Session of the American
Public Health Association in honor of Walter Reed and his
associates in the Yellow Fever Experiment, at Havana, to be
held at Indianapolis on Tuesday Evening, October 10, in con-
nection with the Annual Meeting of the American Public Health
Association.

We have found it necessary to change the
time of this Memorial Session to Wednesday Evening, October 11.
This has been done to suit the convenience of Surgeon General
Patterson, U.S.A., who will be the principal speaker at the session.
Please bear in mind that the Walter Reed Memorial Session will be
held on Wednesday Evening, October 11.

The Indianapolis Committee in charge of the
Memorial Session sincerely hopes it will be possible for you to
be present. We have the assurance of at least four or five of the
men who took part in the Havana Experiment that they will be here.
This Memorial Session will be the high light of the Association
Meeting and the entire Association will be honored in having you
present.

If you cannot attend the session we will
appreciate having a message from you to be read at the meeting.
This measage, of course, may be personal or historical as you may prefer.
If you should wish to describe something of your part in the Experiment
we should be glad to have you do so. In any event we shall be honored
in hearing from you.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Wm. F. King, M.D.,
General Chairman,
225 Wimmer Building. WFK-EEH.
